original: Majjhima Nikāya 136
analyzed: majjhima nikāya
translated: The Collection of Middle-Length Discourses

original: Mahākammavibhaṅgasutta
analyzed: mahākammavibhaṅgasutta
translated: The Great Analysis of Action

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe
translated: Once the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.

original: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā samiddhi araññakuṭikāyaṁ viharati.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena āyasmā samiddhi arañña kuṭikāyam viharati
translated: At that time Venerable Samiddhi was staying in a wilderness hut.

original: Atha kho potaliputto paribbājako jaṅghāvihāraṁ anucaṅkamamāno anuvicaramāno yenāyasmā samiddhi tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā samiddhinā saddhiṁ sammodi.
analyzed: atha kho potaliputtaḥ paribbājakaḥ jaṅghāvihāram anucaṅkamamānaḥ anuvicaramānaḥ yena āyasmā samiddhi tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā samiddhinā saddhim sammodi
translated: Then the wanderer Potaliputta, while walking and wandering for exercise, went to Venerable Samiddhi and exchanged greetings with him.

original: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho potaliputto paribbājako āyasmantaṁ samiddhiṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho potaliputtaḥ paribbājakaḥ āyasmantam samiddhim etat avoca
translated: After discussing various topics, he sat down to one side and said to Samiddhi,

original: “sammukhā metaṁ, āvuso samiddhi, samaṇassa gotamassa sutaṁ, sammukhā paṭiggahitaṁ:
analyzed: sammukhā mā itaḥ āvuso samiddhi samaṇassa gotamassa suta sammukhā paṭiggahita
translated: “Friend Samiddhi, I heard and learned this from the Buddha’s own lips:

original: ‘moghaṁ kāyakammaṁ moghaṁ vacīkammaṁ, manokammameva saccan’ti.
analyzed: mogham kāya kammam mogham vacī kamma manaḥ kammam eva saccanti
translated: ‘Bodily action is in vain, verbal action is in vain, only mental action is real.’

original: Atthi ca sā samāpatti yaṁ samāpattiṁ samāpanno na kiñci vediyatī”ti?
analyzed: atthi ca sā samāpatti yam samāpattim samāpannaḥ na kiñci vediyati iti
translated: And there is a meditative attainment in which one does not feel anything at all.”

original: “Mā hevaṁ, āvuso potaliputta, avaca; mā hevaṁ, āvuso potaliputta, avaca; mā bhagavantaṁ abbhācikkhi. Na hi sādhu bhagavato abbhakkhānaṁ. Na hi bhagavā evaṁ vadeyya:
analyzed: mā ha iva āvuso potaliputta avaca mā ha iva āvuso potaliputta avaca mā bhagavantam abbhācikkhi na hi sādhu bhagavataḥ na hi bhagavā evam vadeyya
translated: “Don’t say that, friend Potaliputta. Don’t misrepresent the Blessed One, for misrepresentation of the Blessed One is not good. The Blessed One would not speak thus.

original: ‘moghaṁ kāyakammaṁ moghaṁ vacīkammaṁ, manokammameva saccan’ti.
analyzed: mogham kāya kammam mogham vacī kamma manaḥ kammam eva saccanti
translated: ‘Bodily action is vain, verbal action is vain, only mental action is real.’

original: ‘Atthi ca kho sā, āvuso, samāpatti yaṁ samāpattiṁ samāpanno na kiñci vediyatī’”ti.
analyzed: atthi ca kho sā āvuso samāpatti yam samāpattim samāpannaḥ na kiñci vediyati iti
translated: ‘There is such a attainment, friend, in which one does not feel anything at all.’”

original: “Kīvaciraṁ pabbajitosi, āvuso samiddhī”ti?
analyzed: kīvaciram pabbajitaḥ asi āvuso samiddhi iti
translated: “How long has it been, friend Samiddhi, since you went forth?”

original: “Na ciraṁ, āvuso, tīṇi vassānī”ti.
analyzed: na cire āvuso tīṇi vassāni iti
translated: “Not long, friend, three years.”

original: “Ettha dāni mayaṁ there bhikkhū kiṁ vakkhāma, yatra hi nāma evaṁnavo bhikkhu satthāraṁ parirakkhitabbaṁ maññissati.
analyzed: ettha dāni mayam there bhikkhū kim vakkhāma yatra hi nāma evanavaḥ bhikkhu satthāram parirakkhitabbam maññissati
translated: “What shall we say of the senior monks, friend, when even a newly-ordained young bhikkhu thinks that the Teacher should be guarded?

original: Sañcetanikaṁ, āvuso samiddhi, kammaṁ katvā kāyena vācāya manasā kiṁ so vediyatī”ti?
analyzed: sañcetanikaḥ āvuso samiddhi kammam katvā kāyena vācāya manasā kim saḥ vediyati iti
translated: Having done an intentional action by way of body, speech, or mind, what does one feel?”

original: “Sañcetanikaṁ, āvuso potaliputta, kammaṁ katvā kāyena vācāya manasā dukkhaṁ so vediyatī”ti.
analyzed: sañcetanikaḥ āvuso potaliputta kammam katvā kāyena vācāya manasā dukkham saḥ vediyati iti
translated: “Having done an intentional action by way of body, speech, or mind, one feels suffering, friend Potaliputta.”

original: Atha kho potaliputto paribbājako āyasmato samiddhissa bhāsitaṁ neva abhinandi nappaṭikkosi;
analyzed: atha kho potaliputtaḥ paribbājakaḥ āyasmataḥ samiddhissa bhāsitam na iva abhinandi na paṭikkosi
translated: Then the wanderer Potaliya neither approved nor dismissed the statement of Venerable Samiddhi.

original: anabhinanditvā appaṭikkositvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
analyzed: an abhinanditvā a paṭikkositvā uṭṭhāya āsanā pakkāmi
translated: He got up from his seat and left.

original: Atha kho āyasmā samiddhi acirapakkante potaliputte paribbājake yenāyasmā ānando tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā ānandena saddhiṁ sammodi.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmā samiddhi acira pakkante potaliputte paribbājake yena āyasmatā ānandaḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā ānandena saddhim sammodi
translated: Then, not long after he had left, Venerable Samiddhi went to Venerable Ānanda and exchanged greetings with him.

original: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.🔽Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho āyasmā samiddhi yāvatako ahosi potaliputtena paribbājakena saddhiṁ kathāsallāpo taṁ sabbaṁ āyasmato ānandassa ārocesi.
analyzed: sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdi  ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho āyasmā samiddhi yāvatakaḥ ahosi potaliputtena paribbājakena saddhim kathā sallāpo tam sabbam āyasmataḥ ānandassa ārocesi
translated: When they had concluded their greetings and cordial talk, he sat down to one side🔽and told him all that had happened.

original: Evaṁ vutte, āyasmā ānando āyasmantaṁ samiddhiṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte āyasman ānandaḥ āyasmantam samiddhim etat avoca
translated: When he had finished, Venerable Ānanda said to him,

original: “atthi kho idaṁ, āvuso samiddhi, kathāpābhataṁ bhagavantaṁ dassanāya.
analyzed: atthi kho idam āvuso bhagavantam dassanāya
translated: “There is a reason why the Buddha has not given this teaching.

original: Āyāmāvuso samiddhi, yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamissāma; upasaṅkamitvā etamatthaṁ bhagavato ārocessāma.
analyzed: āyāma āvuso samidh hi yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkamissāma upasaṅkamitvā etam attham bhagavataḥ ārocessāma
translated: “Come, friend Samiddhi, let’s go to the Blessed One and report this matter to him.

original: Yathā no bhagavā byākarissati tathā naṁ dhāressāmā”ti.
analyzed: yathā naḥ bhagavā byākarissati tathā nam dhāressāma ati
translated: As the Blessed One tells us, so we’ll carry it out.”

original: “Evamāvuso”ti kho āyasmā samiddhi āyasmato ānandassa paccassosi.
analyzed: evam āvuso ti kho āyasmā samiddhi āyasmato ānandassa paccassosi
translated: “As you say, friend,” Ven. Samiddhi responded to Ven. Ānanda.

original: Atha kho āyasmā ca ānando āyasmā ca samiddhi yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu.
analyzed: atha khalu āyasmā ca ānandaḥ āyasmā ca samidh hi yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkamisu upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdisu
translated: Then Ven. Ānanda & Ven. Samiddhi went to the Blessed One and, on arrival, bowed down to him and sat to one side.

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho āyasmā ānando yāvatako ahosi āyasmato samiddhissa potaliputtena paribbājakena saddhiṁ kathāsallāpo taṁ sabbaṁ bhagavato ārocesi.
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho āyasmat ānandaḥ yāvatakaḥ ahosi āyasmato samiddhissa potaliputtena paribbājakena saddhim kathā sallāpaḥ tam sabbam bhagavataḥ ārocesi
translated: As they were sitting there, Ven. Ānanda reported to the Blessed One the entire conversation he had had with Ven. Samiddhi.

original: Evaṁ vutte, bhagavā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte bhagavān āyasmantam ānandam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to Ven. Ānanda,

original: “dassanampi kho ahaṁ, ānanda, potaliputtassa paribbājakassa nābhijānāmi, kuto panevarūpaṁ kathāsallāpaṁ?
analyzed: dassanam pi kho aha ānanda potaliputtassa paribbājakassa na abhijānāmi kutas pana evarūpam kathā sallāpa
translated: “Ānanda, I don’t even recall ever seeing the wanderer Potaliya, so how could there have been such a conversation?

original: Iminā ca, ānanda, samiddhinā moghapurisena potaliputtassa paribbājakassa vibhajjabyākaraṇīyo pañho ekaṁsena byākato”ti.
analyzed: iminā ca ānanda samiddhinā moghapurisena potaliputtassa paribbājakassa vibhajja byākaraṇīyaḥ pañhaḥ ekasena byākato ti
translated: And this foolish man has given a definite answer to the wanderer Potaliya’s question that should have been acknowledged as calling for a definite answer.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, āyasmā udāyī bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte āyasmai udāyī bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, Ven. Udāyī said to the Blessed One,

original: “sace pana, bhante, āyasmatā samiddhinā idaṁ sandhāya bhāsitaṁ—
analyzed: sace pana bhante āyasmatā samiddhinā idam sandhāya bhāsita
translated: “If, lord, this was said by the venerable Sañjīva with reference to

original: yaṁ kiñci vedayitaṁ taṁ dukkhasmin”ti.
analyzed: yam kiñci vedayitam tam dukkhasmin ti
translated: ‘Whatever is felt is suffering,’

original: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān āyasmantam ānandam āmantesi
translated: Then the Blessed One addressed Ven. Ānanda,

original: “passasi no tvaṁ, ānanda, imassa udāyissa moghapurisassa ummaṅgaṁ?🔽Aññāsiṁ kho ahaṁ, ānanda:
analyzed: passasi no tva ānanda imassa udāyissa moghapurisassa ummaṅga  kho aha ānanda
translated: “Ānanda, do you see this foolish man Udāyī’s error?

original: ‘idānevāyaṁ udāyī moghapuriso ummujjamāno ayoniso ummujjissatī’ti.
analyzed: idānā iva ayam udāyī mogha purisaḥ ummujjamānaḥ ayonisaḥ ummujjissati iti
translated: I knew, Ānanda, that this foolish man Udāyī, in his folly, would misrepresent me, would misstate me with what is unfactual & untrue.

original: Ādiṁyeva, ānanda, potaliputtena paribbājakena tisso vedanā pucchitā.
analyzed: ādiyā iva ānanda potaliputtena paribbājakena tissaḥ vedanā pucchitā
translated: From the very beginning, Ānanda, the wanderer Potaliya asked about the three feelings.

original: Sacāyaṁ, ānanda, samiddhi moghapuriso potaliputtassa paribbājakassa evaṁ puṭṭho evaṁ byākareyya:
analyzed: ānanda moghapuriso potaliputtassa paribbājakassa evam puṭṭhaḥ evam byākareyya
translated: If, Ānanda, this foolish man Sañjīva, when asked by the wanderer Potaliya, had answered like this:

original: ‘sañcetanikaṁ, āvuso potaliputta, kammaṁ katvā kāyena vācāya manasā sukhavedanīyaṁ sukhaṁ so vedayati;
analyzed: sañcetanikaḥ āvuso potaliputta kammam katvā kāyena vācāya manasā sukha vedanīyam sukham saḥ vedayati
translated: ‘Friend Potaliya, when an intentional action has been done by way of body, speech, or mind that is to be felt as pleasant, one feels pleasure.

original: sañcetanikaṁ, āvuso potaliputta, kammaṁ katvā kāyena vācāya manasā dukkhavedanīyaṁ dukkhaṁ so vedayati;
analyzed: sañcetanikaḥ āvuso potaliputta kammam katvā kāyena vācāya manasā dukkha vedanīyam dukkham saḥ vedayati
translated: When an intentional action has been done by way of body, speech, or mind that is to be felt as painful, one feels pain.

original: sañcetanikaṁ, āvuso potaliputta, kammaṁ katvā kāyena vācāya manasā adukkhamasukhavedanīyaṁ adukkhamasukhaṁ so vedayatī’ti.
analyzed: sañcetanikaḥ āvuso potaliputta kammam katvā kāyena vācāya manasā adukkham asukha vedanīyam adukkham asukham saḥ vedayati iti
translated: When an intentional action has been done by way of body, speech, or mind that is to be felt as neither-painful-nor-pleasant, one feels what is neither-painful-nor-pleasant.’

original: Evaṁ byākaramāno kho, ānanda, samiddhi moghapuriso potaliputtassa paribbājakassa sammā byākaramāno byākareyya.
analyzed: evam byākaramānaḥ kho ānanda samiddhi moghapurisaḥ potaliputtassa paribbājakassa sammā byākaramānaḥ byākareyya
translated: Answering in this way, Ananda, the foolish man would answer the wanderer Potaliya rightly.

original: Api ca, ānanda, ke ca aññatitthiyā paribbājakā bālā abyattā ke ca tathāgatassa mahākammavibhaṅgaṁ jānissanti?
analyzed: api ca ānanda ke ca añña titthiyāḥ paribbājakāḥ bālāḥ abyattāḥ ke ca tathāgatassa mahā kamma vibhaṅgam jānissanti
translated: But, Ananda, who are these other sectarians, these blind fools, that they would know the Tathāgata’s great analysis of deeds?

original: Sace tumhe, ānanda, suṇeyyātha tathāgatassa mahākammavibhaṅgaṁ vibhajantassā”ti.
analyzed: sace tumhe ānanda suṇeyyātha tathāgatassa mahā kamma vibhaṅgam vibhajantassa ati
translated: If you were to hear the Tathāgata analyzing the great analysis of deeds, you would remember it.”

original: “Etassa, bhagavā, kālo, etassa, sugata, kālo
analyzed: etassa bhagavā kālaḥ etassa sugata kālaḥ
translated: “Now is the time, Blessed One, now is the time, Sublime One,

original: yaṁ bhagavā mahākammavibhaṅgaṁ vibhajeyya. Bhagavato sutvā bhikkhū dhāressantī”ti.
analyzed: yam bhagavā mahā kamma vibhaṅgam vibhajeyya bhagavataḥ sutvā bhikkhū dhāressanti iti
translated: Please explain the Great Analysis of Actions. Having heard it from the Buddha, the monks will remember it.”

original: “Tena hānanda, suṇāhi, sādhukaṁ manasi karohi; bhāsissāmī”ti.
analyzed: tena ha ānanda suṇāhi sādhukam manasi karohi bhāsissāmi iti
translated: “Then listen and pay careful attention, I will speak.”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paccassosi.
analyzed: eva bhante iti kho āyasmai ānandaḥ bhagavataḥ paccassosi
translated: “Yes, lord,” the venerable Ānanda replied.

original: Bhagavā etadavoca:
analyzed: bhagavān etat avoca
translated: The Buddha said this:

original: “Cattārome, ānanda, puggalā santo saṁvijjamānā lokasmiṁ.
analyzed: cattāro me ānanda puggalā santaḥ savijjamānā lokasmi
translated: “Ānanda, there are four kinds of people to be found existing in the world.

original: Katame cattāro?
analyzed: katame cattāro
translated: What are the four?

original: Idhānanda, ekacco puggalo idha pāṇātipātī hoti, adinnādāyī hoti, kāmesumicchācārī
analyzed: idha ānanda ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ idha pāṇa atipātī hoti adinna ādāyī hoti kāmesu micchā cārī
translated: Here, Ānanda, someone is a killer of living beings, a taker of what is not given, one who engages in sexual misconduct,

original: hoti, musāvādī hoti, pisuṇavāco hoti, pharusavāco hoti, samphappalāpī hoti, abhijjhālu
analyzed: hoti musāvādī hoti pisuṇa vācaḥ hoti pharusa vācaḥ hoti samphappalāpī hoti abhijjhālu
translated: one who speaks falsely, one who speaks divisively, one who speaks harshly, one who indulges in idle chatter, one who is full of longing,

original: hoti, byāpannacitto hoti, micchādiṭṭhi hoti.
analyzed: hoti byāpanna cittaḥ hoti micchā diṭṭhi hoti
translated: one who has a mind of ill will, and one who has wrong views.

original: So kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjati.
analyzed: so kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapajjati
translated: With the breakup of the body, after death, he is reborn in hell.

original: Idha panānanda, ekacco puggalo idha pāṇātipātī hoti, adinnādāyī hoti, kāmesumicchācārī
analyzed: idha pana ānanda ekaccaḥ puggalaḥ idha pāṇa atipātī hoti adinna ādāyī hoti kāmesu micchā cārī
translated: Here, Ānanda, someone is a killer of living beings, a taker of what is not given, one who engages in sexual misconduct,

original: hoti, musāvādī hoti, pisuṇavāco hoti, pharusavāco hoti, samphappalāpī hoti, abhijjhālu
analyzed: hoti musāvādī hoti pisuṇa vācaḥ hoti pharusa vācaḥ hoti samphappalāpī hoti abhijjhālu
translated: he is a liar, he is one who speaks divisively, he is one who speaks harshly, he is one who indulges in talking nonsense, he is covetous,

original: hoti, byāpannacitto hoti, micchādiṭṭhi hoti.
analyzed: hoti byāpanna cittaḥ hoti micchā diṭṭhi hoti
translated: he is malevolent, he has wrong view.

original: So kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjati.
analyzed: so kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapajjati
translated: With the breakup of the body, after death, he is reborn in a good destination, in a heavenly world.

original: Idhānanda, ekacco puggalo idha pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti, adinnādānā paṭivirato
analyzed: idha ānanda ekacco puggalo idha pāṇātipātā paṭivirataḥ hoti adinnādānā paṭivirataḥ
translated: Here, Ānanda, someone is one who abstains from killing living beings, from taking what is not given,🔽from misconduct in sensual pleasures, from false speech, from malicious speech,

original: hoti, kāmesumicchācārā paṭivirato hoti, musāvādā paṭivirato hoti, pisuṇāya vācāya🔽paṭivirato hoti, pharusāya vācāya paṭivirato hoti, samphappalāpā paṭivirato hoti,
analyzed: hoti kāmesum icchā ācārā paṭivirataḥ hoti musā vādā paṭivirataḥ hoti pisuṇāya vācāya  paṭivirataḥ hoti pharusāya vācāya paṭivirataḥ hoti samphappalāpā paṭivirataḥ hoti
translated: from harsh speech, from idle chatter,

original: anabhijjhālu hoti, abyāpannacitto hoti, sammādiṭṭhi hoti.
analyzed: an abhijjhālu hoti a byāpanna cittaḥ hoti sammādiṭṭhi hoti
translated: he is not covetous, he is not malevolent, he has right view.

original: So kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjati.
analyzed: so kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapajjati
translated: With the breakup of the body, after death, he is reborn in a good destination, in a heavenly world.

original: Idha panānanda, ekacco puggalo idha pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti, adinnādānā paṭivirato
analyzed: idha pana ānanda ekacco puggalo idha pāṇātipātā paṭivirataḥ hoti adinnādānā paṭivirataḥ
translated: Here, Ānanda, someone is one who abstains from killing living beings, from taking what is not given,

original: hoti, kāmesumicchācārā paṭivirato hoti, musāvādā paṭivirato hoti, pisuṇāya vācāya
analyzed: hoti kāmesum icchā ācārā paṭivirataḥ hoti musā vādā paṭivirataḥ hoti pisuṇāya vācāya
translated: he does not engage in sexual misconduct, he does not lie, he does not engage in malicious speech,

original: paṭivirato hoti, pharusāya vācāya paṭivirato hoti, samphappalāpā paṭivirato hoti,
analyzed: paṭivirataḥ hoti pharusāya vācāya paṭivirataḥ hoti samphappalāpā paṭivirataḥ hoti
translated: he does not engage in harsh speech, he does not engage in gossip,

original: anabhijjhālu hoti, abyāpannacitto hoti, sammādiṭṭhi hoti.
analyzed: an abhijjhālu hoti a byāpanna cittaḥ hoti sammādiṭṭhi hoti
translated: he is not covetous, he is not malicious, he has right view.

original: So kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjati.
